channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MA

item.title: Report X-2023080206
item.description:
Report X-2023080206

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: NATICK
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was left at the cage for processing when I inspected the hazmat, I noticed that the box had wet markings. I open the hazmat to see if it was from the hazmat inside and it was one of the 4-liter bottles released about 3 litters was a quarter full. I immediately brought the hazmat to the hazmat cage for damage processing. DescribePack: None of the bottles were broken one of the hazmat released from a loose cap. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed in a red hazmat bin and taken to the hazmat cage placed under the vents.

item.title: Report X-2023070304
item.description:
Report X-2023070304

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: RAYNHAM
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/11/2023 at approxiamtely 1100, Dangerous Goods Adminstration recieved a call from Employee 530557 at the station location in Raynham, reporting a hydrochloric acid spill. The shipment consisted of 3 fiberboard boxes, one of which leaked. The cause of the leakage is unknown. All three shipment pieces are being held, awaitng an amended to shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found leaking. Placed into spill bucket and brought back to QA cage for further processing. DescribePack: Lid loosened causing material to leak DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Placed into spill bucket to minimize movement and spillage elsewhere.

item.title: Report X-2023070469
item.description:
Report X-2023070469

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: CHELMSFORD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PADDED ENVELOPE DUE TO THE RATTLE SOUND OF AEROSOL CANS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED 4 X 5 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF K2R SPOTLIFTER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
